metadata.Title: CVE-2021-36090 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description: When reading a specially crafted ZIP archive, Compress can be made to allocate large amounts of memory that finally leads to an out of memory error even for very small inputs. This could be used to mount a denial of service attack against services that use Compress' zip package.

criterions.comment: libcommons-compress-java: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
